intro: Deutzia californica, commonly known as the California deutzia, is a deciduous shrub native to the western United States. It features clusters of fragrant, white to pink flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant has slender, arching branches and small, ovate leaves that turn yellow in the fall. It thrives in well-drained soil and partial to full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens and borders. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its showy flowers and seasonal foliage changes.
